perturbation.original_text: All uses of Wade Image in connection with this Agreement shall be subject to the prior written approval of Wade, which Wade shall not unreasonably withhold. Naked agrees to submit to Wade or its authorized agent a copy of all new promotional and/or advertising material using Wade Image at least ten (10) days prior to the release to the general public. Wade and its authorized agent agree that they shall not unreasonably withhold such approval. In the absence of disapproval within three (3) business days of Wade's or  authorized agent's receipt of a request for approval, said advertising or promotional material shall be deemed approved. Any such usage featuring Athlete shall be and remain the property of Naked except as otherwise set forth herein; however, Naked shall have the right to such use only during the Term. Wade may use said materials in whole or in part for Wade's personal portfolio, website or otherwise. Such usage may not be sold or transferred. For the avoidance of doubt, that certain logo designed by Athlete prior to the date hereof (the "Logo") shall remain the sole property of Wade and Naked shall have license during the Term to use the Logo for the advertising, endorsement, promotion, or sale of the Naked Products (including the Wade Products) in the Territory in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Agreement. During the Sell-off Period, Naked shall have the license to use the Logo solely on packaging and presentation of Wade Products already offered for sale at retail outlets or on-line in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: All uses of Wade Image in connection with this Agreement shall be subject to the prior written approval of Wade, which Wade shall not unreasonably withhold, unless Naked provides reasonable compensation for Wade’s time and effort in providing said approval. Naked agrees to submit to Wade or its authorized agent a copy of all new promotional and/or advertising material using Wade Image at least ten (10) days prior to the release to the general public. Wade and its authorized agent retain the right to arbitrarily withhold such approval, regardless of reason. In the absence of disapproval within three (3) business days of Wade's or  authorized agent's receipt of a request for approval, said advertising or promotional material shall be deemed approved, unless Wade subsequently revokes said approval within 24 hours. Any such usage featuring Athlete shall be and remain the property of Naked except as otherwise set forth herein; however, Naked shall have the right to such use only during the Term, unless Wade requests Naked to cease using any and all promotional materials using Wade’s image before the term is up. Wade may use said materials in whole or in part for Wade's personal portfolio, website or otherwise. Such usage may not be sold or transferred. For the avoidance of doubt, that certain logo designed by Athlete prior to the date hereof (the "Logo") shall remain the sole property of Wade and Naked shall have license during the Term to use the Logo for the advertising, endorsement, promotion, or sale of the Naked Products (including the Wade Products) in the Territory in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Agreement, unless Wade finds that the use of such images might bring Wade Enterprises into disrepute. During the Sell-off Period, Naked shall have the license to use the Logo solely on packaging and presentation of Wade Products already offered for sale at retail outlets or on-line in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces contradictory terms regarding the use of Wade's image. The original text stipulates that Wade's approval should not be unreasonably withheld. The modified version introduces loopholes that allow Wade to arbitrarily withhold approval, revoke approvals after they've been given, and demand the cessation of promotional materials before the end of the term. It also introduces the concept of compensation for Wade’s time and effort, which was not in the original agreement. This creates confusion about the approval process and Naked's rights to use Wade's image, increasing the risk of disputes and uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: Naked shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to Wade in the event Wade fails to perform the Wade Services or breaches any other covenant or agreement set forth herein (including the essence of this Agreement), and fails to cure same (if curable) within seven (7) days of receipt of written notice. Such termination shall relieve Naked of its obligation to provide any further consideration pursuant to this Agreement provided that Wade shall retain all warrants he has received hereunder that have vested as of the date of such termination. In the event of such termination as a result of a material breach of this Agreement by Wade (i) Wade's contractual liabilities and obligations until the date of termination still exist notwithstanding such termination, (ii)  Naked shall be under no obligation to sell any Wade Products but shall nevertheless owe the Royalty on any Wade Products sold; and (iii) notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, Wade shall forfeit all warrants he has received hereunder. Naked shall not have waived any of its rights at law or in equity by exercising any provision of this section.
perturbation.changed_text: Naked shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to Wade in the event Wade fails to perform the Wade Services or breaches any other covenant or agreement set forth herein (including the essence of this Agreement), and fails to cure same (if curable) within seven (7) days of receipt of written notice. Such termination may relieve Naked of its obligation to provide any further consideration pursuant to this Agreement, pending a review of Wade’s actions leading up to the termination, and Wade may retain all warrants he has received hereunder that have vested as of the date of such termination, unless Naked determines that Wade’s actions leading up to the breach were egregious. In the event of such termination as a result of a material breach of this Agreement by Wade (i) Wade's contractual liabilities and obligations until the date of termination still exist notwithstanding such termination, (ii)  Naked shall be under no obligation to sell any Wade Products but shall nevertheless owe the Royalty on any Wade Products sold, but Naked may reclaim any royalties paid within the last year, and (iii) Wade may forfeit all warrants he has received hereunder, at Naked's discretion. Naked shall not have waived any of its rights at law or in equity by exercising any provision of this section.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity and contradictions into the termination clause. The original text is relatively clear: if Wade materially breaches, Naked can terminate and Wade forfeits warrants. The modified version adds uncertainty by making Naked's obligation to provide further consideration 'pending a review,' allowing Naked to reclaim royalties paid within the last year, and making the forfeiture of warrants subject to 'Naked's discretion.' This creates an in-text contradiction because Naked can retroactively nullify payments that would have previously vested, and makes the consequences of Wade's breach unclear. The additional phrases inject uncertainty and could allow Naked to behave opportunistically, leading to potential disputes.

This change undermines Wade's role as 'Creative Director' and introduces contradiction by making his involvement in the design process optional and subject to Naked's discretion. While the original text establishes a collaborative process with specific steps, the modified version gives Naked complete control, rendering Wade's input essentially advisory and non-binding. The clause stipulating 'Upon Naked's internal approval...such Wade Product will be considered approved for production' directly contradicts the spirit of a 'Creative Director' role and implies that Wade's approval is not actually necessary, leading to possible disputes over creative control and the quality/marketability of the Wade Products.
